templates.content:
The kayak itself does not offer much in the way of isolating you from the cold, and the integrity and durability of the kayak are not affected by the cold water.
 
As long as the kayak is sheltered and not exposed to the elements, the Oru should be just fine storing in cold environments, although it might get a little tough to unfold and assemble when the material is cold. Like a car, occasional maintenance or repair is needed to keep it in tip-top condition.
templates.name: What is the best way to store my kayak during winter?

templates.content: The Bay model won't collapse when you step onto it; it's strong enough to support your weight as long as you distribute it evenly across the sides and avoid putting all your weight on one side.
templates.name: Will the Bay model collapse when you step onto it?

templates.content: The longevity of a kayak is influenced by how well it is maintained. Regularly rinsing and cleaning the kayak after each use is essential. Additionally, using the kayak appropriately in the intended water conditions also plays a crucial role in its lifespan.
templates.name: How long do these kayaks last? How many years should I expect?

templates.content: We only price match if the purchase was made one week before or after the offer we have.
templates.name: Do you price match?

templates.content:
Thanks for sharing that cool idea, we really appreciate it since it helps us
improve and provide the best service we can. I'll make sure to forward this feedback to the right department so we can look into it and overall make the changes necessary. We'll really take this into consideration since our goal is always to bring the best experiences to our customers!
templates.name: Customer has ideas/recommendations about the products

templates.content:
The Bay ST kayak is our flagship model. It's great for calm waters but it is spray skirt compatible and can be taken on chop and surf as well. It has an adjustable footrest and can accommodate a person up to 6' 4", depending on position preference. It's capable of taking weight up to 300 lbs, including paddler and gear. These are the specifications:

Length: 12' (3.7m)
Width: 25" (63 cm)
Weight: 28 Lbs (13 kg)
Weight Capacity: 300 lbs
Cockpit: 16"x30" (41x76 cm)

Hope this helps and please let me know if there's anything else I can assist you with.
templates.name: Bay ST specs

templates.content:
The Coast XT is our 16' model, made for big water and longer paddling trips - it'll get you where you need to go faster! Although the cockpit size is the same as the Bay, the extra length allows for more legroom inside the kayak and more space to store your gear. It has an adjustable footrest and can accommodate a person up to 6' 7", depending on position preference. It's capable of taking weight up to 400 lbs, including paddler and gear. These are the specifications:

Length: 16' (4.9 m)
Width: 25" (63 cm)
Weight: 34 lbs (15 kg)
Weight Capacity: 400 lbs (181 kg)
Cockpit: 16" x 30" (41 X 76 cm)

Hope this helps and please let me know if there's anything else I can assist you with.
templates.name: Coast XT specs

templates.content:
To put the Oru Pack on the kayak you have to put it on its side first. Once it's
sideways you will put the pack over it and gently pull it down. It might get stuck on the edges, so gently pull it over the edge and then down. Once it is completely on, you can put it upwards and close the pack.
templates.name: How to put the Oru pack on the kayak

templates.content: Unfortunately, we do not exchange kayaks at the moment.
templates.name: Do you offer exchanges?

templates.content: We offer international shipping if you purchase from our website. We have distribution centers in the US, CA, AUS, and the EU. If you live in one of these areas and we have this item at our different warehouses we can get a custom shipping quote that may be better than the price offered at the check out. We would only need your full address and we're all set!
templates.name: International shipping

templates.content: The kayak itself does not offer much in the way of isolating you from the cold and the integrity and durability of the kayak are not affected by the cold water. As long as the kayak is sheltered and not exposed to the elements, the Oru should be just fine storing in cold environments, although it might get a little tough to unfold and assemble when the material is cold.
templates.name: Weather conditions/storage

templates.content: Our kayaks are created from a sturdy material that can withstand 20,000 bends. This means that even if you were to fold and unfold every day that would be around +27 years of life! While they are abrasion-resistant (sliding over rocks, bumping into obstacles) keep in mind each kayak is rated for different water types and we recommend avoiding rough use to prolongue it's life.
templates.name: Kayak durability (for folds)

templates.content: I'll be more than glad to help you out. Here are the weight capacities for all of our boat models: Lake: 250 lbs, Beach LT: 300 lbs, Inlet: 275 lbs, Bay ST: 300 lbs, Coast XT: 400 lbs, and Haven: 500 lbs. Let me know if you have further questions that I can help with!
templates.name: Weight capacity - all models

templates.content: These cuts are normal and part of the design of the kayak. They are called Tension Relief Cuts and it is made to release tension when folding the kayak. This will help the skin so it doesn't break when folding the kayak!
templates.name: Tension Relief Cuts

templates.content:
We've traveled to numerous tradeshows and other events both domestically and internationally, and with the Oru Pack we've never had any trouble. On American airlines, if you're traveling with sports equipment your allowance for the bag becomes 121 linear inches and 50 pounds (instead of 62 inches and 50lbs) at
the cost of one regular checked bag (they waive the oversize bag fee if it's sports equipment). Without the Oru Pack, it might be a little harder for it to pass as regular baggage and not get charged with oversized fees, but it's really up to the discretion of the airline and its staff.
templates.name: Airline travel with an Oru

templates.content: To properly use the helicopter tape, we recommend using something with a hard edge, like a credit card, to really massage the tape into the grooves of the boat. Then leave it to sit overnight - 24 hours will really allow it to adhere. If you take it out on the water too soon after applying the tape, it won't be effective.
templates.name: Repair instructions-helicopter tape

templates.content: Our orders are shipped directly from our fulfillment center in El Centro and we are unable to offer customer pickup at this time.
templates.name: Do you offer pick ups?

templates.content: Our boats are naturally buoyant, so even if submerged with water, the kayak wouldn't fully sink. However, you can use float bags and PFDs for safety precautions!
templates.name: Will they sink?

templates.content: The Beach LT is built for calm weather use and light conditions. It's very stable due to its flat bottom and has good overall performance. Excellent for calm types of water and beginners! The Bay ST is our original model. Sporty and sleek, it offers high performance at 26 pounds. It's capable of reaching nice speeds - due to its shape, it cuts easily through the water and can be used on choppy types of water. Great for beginners and intermediates alike!
templates.name: Bay ST versus Beach LT

After making your decision on which Oru Kayak and accessories you'd like to purchase, during checkout you'll be able to select "Affirm" as your option. This will redirect you to their site, where you'll be able to pick and choose the payment plan that best fits your needs. If approved through Affirm, we will then begin to process your order.  Please note that Affirm works with any Oru approved discounts and it works only for U.S purchases.

templates.content: The Inlet Pack is made of rugged heavy-duty nylon, with a super-comfortable shoulder and hip strap system. It's loaded with smart features to make your Oru Kayak journeys easy and convenient.
templates.name: Inlet Pack specs

templates.content: We do not recommend traveling with your kayak built on top of your car - even if it's strapped down, it greatly increases the chance of damaging your boat, and we would hate to see that. The safest way to travel is with it stored, and folded inside your car as the great thing about the Oru is its transportability!
templates.name: Can I put the Kayak on a roof rack or cart/wagon?

templates.content: The Oru Kayak skin is extremely durable and puncture-resistant. However, if you do get a leak, our repair kit will keep you afloat. It includes high-bond waterproof tape patches and primer stick to improve glue and tape bonding.
templates.name: Repair kit specs

templates.content: If you're entering the Oru Kayak from the beach, position the Oru Kayak so that the cockpit is at the water's edge. Hold your paddle behind you with both hands, perpendicular to the boat (the spoon side of the paddle should be face-up). Use 1 hand to do 2 things: hold the paddle at its midpoint behind the cockpit while simultaneously gripping the back edge of the cockpit's combing (outer edge). Tilt the paddle so one blade rests on the beach. Make sure to keep your weight over the paddle (it's ok to sit on the shaft as you enter the cockpit). Place your feet in the boat, then slide your legs in. Use the paddle as a stabilizing brace. Then bring the paddle in front of you and use both hands to push the boat into the water. With 1 hand, place the paddle blade-down into the sand and push. With the other hand, make a fist, push it onto the beach and drive the boat into the water. Use your hips to add extra forward thrust. Once it's clear of the beach, start paddling.
templates.name: Tips on getting into the kayak from a beach

templates.content:
The Haven is our 16' tandem model, designed for two. It combines the easy setup and stability of the Beach with the performance capabilities of the Coast - it also converts from a double-seater to a single-seater by switching a few straps. It is
capable of taking wieght up to 500 lbs, including paddlers and gear. There are the specifications: 

Length: 16' (4.9 m)
Width: 31" (79 cm)
Weight: 40 Lbs. (18 kg)
Weight Capacity: 500 lbs (227 kg)
Cockpit: 20" x 60" (51 x 152 cm)

Hope this helps and please let me know if there's anything else I can assist you with.
templates.name: Heaven specs

templates.content:
The skin of the Oru Kayak is made out of a very durable 5mm corrugated polypropylene with a 10-year UV treatment, that has been rated to 20,000 folds! We've tested it thoroughly on rock shores- that said, if you run against super sharp rocks and reef, it's possible it could damage the hull. We would recommend
treating the Orus as you would treat any other skin-on-frame boat to keep in tip top shape.
templates.name: Durability of kayaks

templates.content: While Oru Kayaks are naturally buoyant and won't sink even when submerged, float bags keep you afloat and maneuverable if you capsize or take on water. Our custom-shaped float bags fit securely in the bow and stern compartments, and include flexible valve stems for easy inflation.
templates.name: Float bags specs

templates.content:
If you're planning on paddling with your pup, our Beach LT and Inlet are the best options for you because they have a large, open cockpit that can accommodate you and your dog. Our Bay ST and Coast XT models have smaller, closed cockpits that make it harder to paddle together. If you want to paddle with another person as well as your dog, our Haven tandem model would also work well, since it also has a large cockpit.

However, please keep in mind that the Inlet has a lower max weight capacity when compared to our other models. Also, out of our 3 open-cockpit models, the Inlet has the smallest cockpit. Hope this helps!
templates.name: I want to paddle with my dog. Which kayak do you recommend?

templates.content: I apologize for the inconvenience, I truly understand how you feel right now. I myself would be the same - we are here to help ease the process for you, and we will sort this out together. Also, if written instructions aren't useful, one of my colleagues would be happy to hop on a phone call or video call as well - just let me know.
templates.name: Assembly issues-frustrated customer

templates.content: We are excited to know that you are considering us to be part of your paddling adventure! The Bay ST model has an oval shaped cockpit that measures 16 in x 30 in. However, people with wide hips but narrow waists can fit, it's just a squeeze to get in. The Beach LT might be a more comfortable fit with the open cockpit.
templates.name: Bay ST - Narrow waist

templates.content: The Inlet shares the same open cockpit as the Beach LT, so they're both easy to get in and out of. The Inlet is two feet shorter than the Beach LT, but also 6 lbs. lighter and more compact when folded up. We'd suggest choosing the Inlet over the Beach LT if you're mostly planning on shorter, flatwater paddles and ease of transportation is extra important to you! However, the Beach LT has much better performance on the water because of the extra length and is better for longer paddles. For more info, check out the comparison page on our site: https://www.orukayak.com/pages/compare
templates.name: Inlet versus Beach LT

templates.content: If you're exiting the Oru Kayak from the beach, paddle up to the beach, until your kayak is securely on the sand. Place the paddle behind you, perpendicular to the boat. Press down onto the paddle, pushing into the kayak, and leveraging your torso out of the cockpit. Once your torso is out of the kayak, pull one leg at a time, out of the boat.
templates.name: Tips on getting out of the kayak from a beach

templates.content: Safety is always first and we're glad to know you are looking to be prepared. There are several self-rescue techniques that you can try. We recommend practicing them in controlled environments and using the right gear such as float bags, dry bags for your gear and a PFD for yourself. The Float bags help by displacing water that would otherwise fill a compromised kayak, float bags make recovering a capsized kayak a lot simpler. Water is heavy and it is much harder to try to flip a kayak filled with water and the Oru can easily get bent out of shape in that situation. Float bags for a kayak are similar to a PFD for you. You can also watch this video on saftey and self rescue: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=khUx-Kx3_0I&list=PL08ykIUY3NqePE7mTtLlVZSenkqDmTOE2&index=20
templates.name: Self rescue on a closed cockpit kayak

templates.content: As long as the kayak is sheltered and not exposed to the elements, the Oru should be just fine storing in your garage. However, it might get a little tough to unfold and assemble when the material is hot. We recommend waiting for it to cool down before unfolding and assembling the kayak.
templates.name: Hot temperatures

templates.content:
I can assure you that your floorboard is not defective - these score marks do appear to be a bit rough on the finished product, but they are imperative for folding and flexibility. Their cosmetic appearance is something we're working on addressing with our Design Team. At this time, even if we send you a replacement floorboard, it would still have the same appearance as the one you have. All of our Havens coming off the production line look like this, so we can assure you that you do have the correct, finished product.

That being said, I completely understand your concern and we have a record of your texts in case any further issues develop. These cuts will not affect the performance of the product whatsoever.

This black, sleek, top-tier paddle comes in at a much lighter 1.8 pounds. This lightweight paddle allows you to travel faster and for longer distances without getting tired. It also comes with a carrying case.

It features padded shoulder straps and a hip belt for ergonomic carrying, two handles (top and side) for luggage handling, extra-long, heavy-duty zipper for easy access, exterior mesh pockets for carrying a two-piece paddle, and compression straps for attaching additional gear. It's compatible with our Beach LT, Bay ST and Coast XT kayaks only.

templates.content: Oru Dry Bags provide versatile, durable, and waterproof protection for your gear and can withstand just about any abuse you can dish out - from everyday use to remote expeditions where wet gear is not an option. You can close them quickly and securely with a standard roll-top and buckle system.

While the Oru Kayak hull is extremely durable and unlikely to get a hole, we like to prepare for any situation, and super sharp rocks and boulders can cause damage. If you do develop a hole or some other form of damage to the skin, we have some options! 

The Oru Repair Kit will keep you afloat. It includes high-bond waterproof tape patches, expanding foam sealant that can be injected inside the double-layered skin, and primer sticks to improve glue and tape bonding. And if you are still within the 1-year warranty period, send us a message at service@orukayak.com. We will take care of you!
templates.name: What happens if I develop a hole or damage in the hull of my boat?

templates.content: To clean your Oru Kayak, we recommend rinsing thoroughly with fresh water after each use - sediment and salt that dry to the surface of the boat can be abrasive over time. If possible, rinsing your kayak down with a hose is optimal. Soap and water is also fine for cleaning purposes, and won't damage the skin! Bring along a towel or shammy to dry, especially when you will be storing it long-term in between paddles.
templates.name: How do I clean my kayak?

templates.content: Oru Kayaks have many advantages over inflatables. Oru Kayaks need a quick wipe down with a towel after use, then you can fold them up until next time. Inflatables need to dry out for a day after use to prevent mildew. Oru Kayaks cut through the water and track like a dream due to the rigid hull. Inflatables often have poor tracking and can be difficult to paddle. If you want to go fast and stay on course, choose the smooth maneuverability of an Oru. Inflatables always have a risk of puncture, so rocks and boulders pose a risk. Oru Kayaks have an extremely tough hull made out of corrugated plastic, and while we also recommend avoiding sharp rocks and boulders when possible, our boats are designed to handle bumps and scratches along the way.
templates.name: Oru Kayaks versus Inflatables

templates.content: Here are our tips and tricks for getting into the kayak. If you're entering the Oru Kayak from a dock, we suggest that you place the Oru Kayak in the water, parallel to the dock. Sit on the dock, parallel to the boat. Then place the paddle on top of the kayak, directly behind the cockpit and perpendicular to the boat. Still holding onto the paddle (pressing it into the kayak for support and stability), position yourself over the cockpit. Without sitting all the way into the cockpit, place both legs into the boat. Extend both legs into the boat, before sitting down completely into the cockpit. Do not sit down in the cockpit first and then try to extend your legs afterward.
templates.name: Tips on entering the kayak from a dock

templates.content: During the early stages of assembly, you probably missed a fold, and the ends of the boat aren't inverted correctly. This prevents the fairings from stretching up and over, and clipping into place, and makes them appear too short. You need to "pop" back out the fold.
templates.name: My fairing is too short, and I can't stretch it up and clip it into place - inverted bow

templates.content: Traditional rotomolded hardshell kayaks are heavy and take up space. You can store 8-10 Orus in the space you can store 1 traditional 12 ft kayak. You will still have rigid kayak performance on the water, but more space in your home or garage. Because they are so compact, they pack in the trunk of your car! No need to spend extra money on a roof rack. We've been told this can help you save on gas $$ too! Our kayaks also have 60% less plastic than traditional rotomolded kayaks on average. There's no need to lift it above your head on a roof rack or recruit friends to help you port it to the water. It's lightweight and easy to transport in a pack, you can walk, bike, or bus it to the water.
templates.name: Oru Kayaks versus other Hardshell Kayaks

templates.content: Our "Try Before You Buy" program allows you to experience Oru products in the outdoor spaces of real customers. templates.content: Your Hull Identification Number (HIN) is located on a small white plate, toward the stern of the boat. It begins with "OKA" and is 12 digits long. It's also located on a small white sticker on the shipping box that your kayak arrives in.
templates.name: Where can I find my Hull I.D. number?

templates.content: The best way to handle this is to email us directly at service@orukayak.com. Our team is happy to help!
templates.name: Customer support

templates.name: What if I send back a sealed box?

templates.name: Why do I need to include pictures?

templates.content: I'm afraid refurbished kayaks can't be refunded as they are discounted price due to aesthetic conditions that don't affect product performance.
templates.name: Can I return my refurbished kayak?

templates.content: If you're exiting the Oru Kayak from a dock, paddle up to the dock, until you are directly parallel to it. Place the paddle behind you, perpendicular to the boat, in the same position as when you entered the kayak. Holding the paddle and pressing it down into the kayak, push yourself up and out of the cockpit and sit onto the dock. Pull one leg out of the kayak, then the other.
templates.name: Tips for getting out of the kayak from a dock

templates.content:
Safety is always first and we're glad to know you're looking to be prepared. Please keep in mind that while the Inlet is very stable it's not designed for open water due to it being a recreational kayak. This means paddling far from shore in rough waters is dangerous. Don't paddle anywhere that you can't swim back to shore from easily, and don't paddle in cold water, especially without protective gear. 

Our float bags are a good companion that help by displacing water that would otherwise fill a compromised kayak. Water is heavy and it's much harder to try to flip a kayak filled with water and the Oru can easily get bent out of shape in that situation. Float bags for a kayak are similar to a PFD for you. However, good paddling conditions for your kayak and practice will keep you safe. We have had customers try self rescue in controlled environments however body dimensions such as height and weight are a key factor.
templates.name: Self rescue on an inlet

templates.content: Our float bags are custom-made to fit the Bay and the Coast only, mostly because these boats are intended for rougher water. For the Beach, Haven, and Inlet, since they're made for calm, sheltered water and have large, open cockpits, you may need more than one pair on each side so they can fit better.
templates.name: Float bags compatibility

templates.content: Not to worry - it is quite normal for a little water to come into the kayak or corrugated flutes during paddling. This will not affect the safety or performance of the boat. The best way to get the water out of the flutes in the corrugated hull is either to stand the boats up or unbuckle the deck straps and lay them on their bellies over a table. Make sure to do this outside, as the water will quickly stream out of both ends of the boat!
templates.name: Water in corrugated flutes

templates.content: The material is not biodegradable. We designed it to be used for a long time and that requires a durable plastic that won't break down from sun exposure or in corrosive salt water conditions. That said - the white material is recyclable at the end of its lifespan. It can be cut up and put in most municipal recycling bins.
templates.name: Is the material biodegradable?

templates.content: The Bay and the Coast are designed to accommodate a person up to 6'3". That said, another thing to keep in mind is that the cockpit on both series is a standard size, and measures 16" x 30". The Beach, Haven, and Inlet have a larger, open cockpit, that is designed to make getting in and out simple. They also provide ample space for taller folks to position their knees. Hopefully this is useful, but please let me know if you need more information, and I'd be happy to help!
templates.name: Tall paddler

templates.content: This nylon skirt is custom-designed to fit perfectly around Oru Kayak cockpits. With an adjustable tube and cockpit, this skirt will fit you and your kayak, just the way you like. More affordable than its big brother, the Oru Spray Skirt, the nylon skirt will keep you dry as you paddle through moderate waters.
templates.name: Nylon spray skirt specs

templates.content:
Thanks for letting us know that, I'm sorry to hear this, we want nothing but the best experiences for our customers and we're definitely thinking about improving our seats! We are in the midst of fixing this for customers who are interested in a more comfortable seat. A good alternative that we can recommend at the moment is the gel seat we have on our website and you can check it here:
https://www.orukayak.com/products/gel-seat
templates.name: Uncomfortable seat cushion

templates.content: The Oru Paddle - in bright white to match the kayak - breaks down into four pieces, so it stows easily inside the Oru Kayak in box form. It features a lightweight fiberglass shaft and super-tough ABS plastic blades. The paddle is truly customizable: a quick-clamp connector allows you to adjust both the length (220-230cm) of the paddle.
templates.name: Oru Paddle specs

templates.content:
At this time, we do not have a buy-back or trade-in program in place, although
that is something we are looking to implement in the near future. I'm sorry that I don't have a better solution for you at the moment - but we do know of customers who have had success with Craigslist.com or other resellers of their choice.
templates.name: Buy-back/ trade in programs

templates.content:
It has a weather-tested seal that's custom-designed to fit perfectly around Oru
Kayak cockpits. The skirt is made of neoprene, a material that is comfortable, durable, breathable, and easy to snap on and off. It's a simple way to get a dry ride in any kind of water.
templates.name: Neoprene spray skirt specs

templates.content: The Luci Lights are 100% solar-powered and take only hours to charge. Each light can be inflated in seconds, deflated for easy storage, and recharged again and again for reuse. Simple to use and just plain cool, these lights are a must for all who plan to paddle at night.
templates.name: Luci Lights specs

templates.content:
The Bay ST is our original model. Sporty and sleek it offers high performance at 26 pounds - it's great for beginners and intermediates alike. The Coast XT is our flagship model - built for multi-day expeditions. It can pack in extra gear. The
additional length offers the best tracking in the Oru line up. Both being closed cockpit kayaks, they can be used in choppy water and can also fit a spray skirt for extra splash protection.
templates.name: Bay ST versus Coast XT

templates.content:
The warranty for our certified refurbished kayaks varies depending on the model. You can take a look at the specific warranty for each below: 

 Certified refurbished "Like New" Models have a 1-year warranty guarantee.
 Certified refurbished "Good" Condition Models have a 6-Month Warranty Guarantee
 Certified refurbished "Fair" Condition Models have a 3-Month Warranty Guarantee
templates.name: What is the warranty on your certified refurbished boats?

templates.content: Our processing time takes 2-3 business days and we usually ship via UPS or FedEx. Once shipped, it will take 5-7 business days for domestic orders, and 10-14 business days for international orders.
templates.name: Shipping time

templates.content: We don't currently offer free shipping, but all promos will always be shared with our SMS subscribers or on our website, so keep an eye out!

templates.name: Shipping Fees

templates.content: The average size of the xs dog pfd is 16-20 in; 15-30 lbs.
templates.name: What is the size of the XS canine floatation device?

templates.content:
Oru Lake is best for light and fast fun on calm waters. Oru Inlet is best for beginners and calm water adventures. Oru Beach LT is best for light and easy kayaking on calm waters.

Oru Beach LT Sport is best for calm waters with added features for versatility. Oru Bay ST is great for various conditions, including casual cruising and fishing. Oru Coast XT is great for serious adventurers and challenging conditions. Oru Haven TT is best for tandem or single-seater flatwater kayaking.
templates.name: I live near a lake. Which Kayak should I get?

templates.content: We do have tight braces that are located inside the cockpit for the Coast XT model. If you'd like, you can check them out here: https://orukayak.attn.tv/sl/634Tl0t0

templates.content: For new kayaks purchased directly from us, our warranty lasts for 3 years from the moment the kayak is received. This warranty also applies if you purchase from one of our retailers, but make sure to register your kayak on our Warranty Registration page.
